data.value: You can consume the ATB gauge to unleash abilities.
When HP is low, use Cura to restore HP.

You can unleash a limit break 
when the limit gauge is full.

Allies in your party will fight automatically. 
However, you will need to manually execute their limit breaks.

The Guard Hound is a troublesome foe that attacks relentlessly. 
Target it to focus your attacks.

Some enemies have weaknesses. 
Sentries are weak to lightning and fire, so use the corresponding abilities to attack.

Weaknesses and resistances differ between enemies.  
Use the best abilities in each situation to emerge victorious.
The Scorpion Sentinel is preparing to unleash a powerful attack.
The Scorpion Sentinel is about to unleash a powerful attack.

You can now use Command Stance, which allows 
you to shift between two types of commands.

Use command stance to brace for its attack. 
Defense Stance specializes in defensive actions.

Now, switch to Attack stance to focus on offensive actions
and to gain benefits such as improved strength.

The enemy has activated Stream Phrase: Protection Wall. 
While active, attacks against the Scorpion Sentinel are less effective.

When these sigils appear, destroy them and reduce the number 
on the left to 0 to disrupt the phase and incapacitate the enemy.

The sigils can be destroyed with attack abilities, 
and you can destroy more sigils in Attack Stance.
Switch to Attack Shift.

Use abilities to destroy sigils. 
Destroy more by targeting ones of the same shape.

The next attack will destroy the remaining sigils. 
Try using an ability.

Unleashing a limit break simultaneously with other characters 
has benefits such as increased damage.
Unleash the limit break of the first character.
Unleash the limit breaks of the other characters.
Party Formation 1
Party Formation 2
Battle Details and Party Optimization
A character's equipment affects their power and stats.
Toggle the display to view their respective abilities.

C. abilities (Command abilities) can be unleashed during battle 
when equipped with a main weapon, ability weapon, or materia.

R. abilities (Reinforcement abilities) have passive benefits that are always in effect 
when equipped with a main weapon, ability weapon, or sub weapon.

S. abilities (Support abilities) affect their paired materia and are determined
based on a character's main weapon.
Further equipment details can be viewed from Help.

When gear is set for "Battle", its appearance
and the R. ability will be reflected.

When gear is set for "Skin", 
only its appearance is reflected.
Summon Abilities
Weapons can be enhanced using materials.

Duplicate weapons obtained from draws 
can be viewed at the armory.
Further enhancement details can be viewed from Help.

Weapons in the armory can be converted to
Weapon-specific Parts used to upgrade rarity or to Overboost.

Turning on auto-convert will automatically
convert weapons sent to the armory.
There are no disadvantages to using auto-convert.
The Workshop
Materia can be enhanced using materials and other materia.
You can also sell materia you no longer need.
Synthesizing Materia
One materia can be synthesized per synthesis slot.
Select a slot.
The materia to synthesize will be displayed.

The materia's details will then be displayed. 
Its rarity and sub stats will not be determined until it is complete.
Select a recipe.
Try synthesizing a materia. (Materials and gil will not be consumed for this attempt.)

After a set amount of time, synthesis will be complete. 
Each materia has a different creation time.
Try using an item to speed up the process.
Using a Synthesis Bookmark will shorten the creation time by an hour.

Try using a Synthesis Bookmark. 
(A Synthesis Bookmark will not be consumed for this attempt.)
You can now collect the materia.
Now that it is complete, the materia's rarity and sub stats have been determined.
Use synthesis to obtain your ideal materia.
You can now add additional materials.

Try and create a Cure materia 
using additional materials.

Select the materials and amount to add. 
Different material combinations have different outcomes.

Add 4 Synth Catalyst - Dawns and 4 Synth Catalyst - Days. 
They will not be consumed for this attempt.
Try shortening the creation time.

Shortening synthesis duration. 
A Synthesis Bookmark will not be consumed for this attempt.
You can now collect the materia.
The combination and amount of materials used affect a materia's rarity and sub stats.
Try synthesizing materia using different materials.

You can upgrade materia that has reached max. Lv. 
(A materia has been prepared for you.)
Materia can be upgraded from Enhance Materia.
Specific materials are needed to upgrade materia.
Try upgrading a materia. (Materials and gil will not be consumed for this attempt.)

The materia has been upgraded to Cura. 
Upgrading a materia may also increase its rarity.
Upgrading Materia
Character Streams
Character Growth

Character Streams allows you to foster the growth of character. 
Let's focus on Cloud's growth.

Characters' memories are required to unlock nodes. 
(Materials will not be consumed this time.)
You can access character statstreams from Growth.
By unlocking a node, the character's stats have increased.
Acquiring Limit Breaks
You can now acquire limit breaks.
The information of the selected limit break will be displayed.
Limit breaks can be acquired by completing the respective Limit Break Missions.

Limit Breaks can be obtained by completing 
all Unlock Missions of the respective Limit Break Mission.
Summon Streams
Binding Summons
Cooldown Timers for Summon Stream Missions
Draw Types
Stamp Cards
Obtaining Gear
Select Draws have wishlists.

Weapons in the wishlist have better odds of being obtained.
Try adding weapons to the list.
The wishlist contains featured and selectable weapons for each draw.
Duplicate Weapons 1
Duplicate Weapons 2
Select Squares
Multiplayer Battles
Attempting Multiplayer Battles 1
Attempting Multiplayer Battles 2
Attempting Multiplayer Battles 3
Raise
First-Time Matching Rewards 1
First-Time Matching Rewards 2
More about Criterion Dungeons
Dungeon Exploration
Criterion Dungeon Battles
Dungeon-Specific Items

In the home screen, you'll find the Mission Guide,
a feature that shows your next task.
Obtain a weapon from the mission guide.
Perform a draw.
Now that you have performed a draw, check the mission guide.
Collect your reward for completing the task.
Your next task is displayed.
Now try enhancing a weapon.
Select the Buster Sword.
Weapons can be enhanced using materials.
You can select the items to use.

Enhancing a weapon boosts its stats,
as well as unlocks and enhances abilities.
Now check the mission guide.

The mission guide shows your next target. 
If you're unsure of what to do, take a look at it.

You can switch between two modes: 
Story Party and Free Party.

Free Party mode allows you to 
use the characters of your choice.

Bonus rewards can only be obtained
in Story Party mode.
More about Enhancement Quests
Enhancement Quest Types
More about Chocobo Farm
Chocobo Expeditions 1
Chocobo Expeditions 2

Tap Change Expedition, then select a destination 
and team to send on a new expedition.
Stamina Boost
Inventory Items
The Battle Tower
You can access the battle tower from Solo Content.
In the Sealed Tower of the Cetra, aim for the bottom by clearing battles.

You can check the recommended sigils, 
elements, power, and the rewards.

There are also environmental effects within the
battle tower that influence your party during battle.
Give it a try.
Crisis Dungeons
Crisis Dungeons
Materia Recipes
Dungeon Keys

Crisis Dungeons grant 
Trance Abilities with various effects.
Utilize the abilities to create the optimal party.
Trance Abilities

As the Crisis Level increases, 
the enemies will become stronger.
Summon Quests
Summon Quest Rewards
Daily Quests
Daily Quests
Try setting rewards.
Select the rewards you would like to obtain.
A reward will be chosen randomly from your selection.
Story Quests
Character Story Quests
You can change your wallpaper from the menu screen.
Select a wallpaper to display.
You can obtain rewards by raising your Exploration Lv.

Premium Route rewards can be obtained
by purchasing additional routes.

The Auto-battle feature is now available. 
You can choose from the Manual-battle.

SEMI: Unleashes C. Abilities when ATB gauge is full
AUTO: Performs all actions except Limit Breaks

The Double Speed feature is now available.
This allows you to toggle the speed of battles.

You can now switch the character you control 
by tapping other character's UI.
Counterattacks
Pyramid
Incinerate
Force Gauge: Ignition
Force Gauge: Ice Age

A single party is comprised of <color=#95C7FF>up to 3 characters.</color> You can tap to switch characters or equipment.
 
<color=#9DB2CC>*The party leader is the character you control at the beginning of battle.</color>
You can <color=#95C7FF>check the details of a battle</color> beforehand. Tap <color=#95C7FF>Recommended Formation</color> to automatically create an optimal party for that battle.

A character's <color=#95C7FF>power</color> is determined by their attributes and equipment, and a party's <color=#95C7FF>total power</color> by the sum of all characters' power. Every battle has a <color=#95C7FF>recommended power</color> value that indicates the battle's difficulty.
<color=#9DB2CC>*Recommended power is only displayed before battle.</color>

A cooldown timer is triggered when starting a summon stream mission. The timer is shared across all summons.
  
<color=#9DB2CC>*The cooldown timer is not triggered when changing missions for the first time.</color>
At the workshop, weapon parts can be converted into <color=#95C7FF>weapon medals</color>, which can then be used at the exchange.
<color=#95C7FF>Synthesis</color> has been unlocked. You can now <color=#95C7FF>synthesize materia</color> through Enhance.
<color=#95C7FF>Upgrade Materia</color> has been unlocked. You can <color=#95C7FF>further enhance materia</color> through Enhance Materia.

<color=#95C7FF>Character streams</color> have been unlocked. You can <color=#95C7FF>boost characters' stats</color> as well as <color=#95C7FF>acquire and enhance their limit breaks</color>.
 
Character streams can be accessed from Growth.

<color=#95C7FF>Unlocking statstream nodes increases the stat as shown on the node.</color>
 
<color=#9DB2CC>*Character-specific or common memories are required to unlock nodes.</color>
New limit breaks can now be acquired through <color=#95C7FF>character streams</color>.

<color=#95C7FF>Summon streams</color> have been unlocked. You can bind summons to acquire and enhance their abilities.
 
Summon streams can be accessed from Growth.

<color=#95C7FF>Completing the Pact Missions</color> of a summon allows you to bind that summon and equip one of their abilities as <color=#95C7FF>an L. ability in place of a limit break</color>.
  
<color=#9DB2CC>*Pact Mission details can be viewed from the list of stream missions.</color>

A <color=#95C7FF>cooldown timer</color> is triggered when starting or changing missions. <color=#95C7FF>Until the timer is up, you must wait to begin or change missions.</color>
<color=#9DB2CC>*The cooldown timer is shared across all summons.
*The cooldown timer is not triggered when changing missions for the first time.</color>

There are three types of <color=#95C7FF>draws:</color>
  
- Stamp draw: A draw that yields a stamp for every Draw 10
- Special draw: A special draw
- Ticket draw: A draw that requires tickets

In a <color=#95C7FF>stamp draw</color>, a <color=#95C7FF>Draw 10</color> yields one or several stamps for your <color=#95C7FF>stamp card.</color> You will <color=#95C7FF>obtain the rewards on the stamped squares.</color>
 
<color=#9DB2CC>*Progress can be viewed from stamp card details.</color>
<color=#95C7FF>Gear</color> can be obtained from stamp cards. Gear changes your appearance and shares the effects of its R. abilities (Reinforcement abilities).
When obtaining <color=#95C7FF>a duplicate weapon of a higher rarity</color>, the rarity of <color=#95C7FF>your currently-held weapon will increase to match</color> that of the new weapon.

<color=#95C7FF>The duplicate weapon</color> will then be sent to <color=#95C7FF>the armory</color>.
  
If it was of a <color=#95C7FF>higher rarity</color> than the one held, the <color=#95C7FF>rarity will decrease to match that of the one held.</color>

Stamp cards have <color=#95C7FF>"Select" squares</color> that allow you to select one reward from several.
 
<color=#9DB2CC>*If a "Select" square reward has not yet been obtained, it can be changed from the stamp card details.</color>

<color=#95C7FF>Multiplayer battles</color> have been unlocked. <color=#95C7FF>Team up with other players</color> to take on enemies in battle.
 
Multiplayer battles can be accessed from Multiplayer Content.
You can create a lobby to search for other players, or join another player's lobby by invitation or the room ID search.

There are two ways to look for party members.
 
Private matches allow you to invite friends, while random matches automatically group you with other players who wish to partake in the same battle.

To participate in random matches, your power must meet the required power shown in the stage details.
 
*Stamina will not be consumed until after your first victory.

In multiplayer battles, you can revive allies with the special ability Raise.
 
*Each ally can only be revived once.
When teaming up with a player for the first time, you will receive a first-time matching reward after the battle.

The reward varies based on the number of players matched.
 
1 - 20 players: 50 blue crystals
21 - 200 players: 20 blue crystals
201+ players: Multiplayer medals

<color=#95C7FF>Criterion Dungeons</color> have been unlocked. This feature allows you to <color=#95C7FF>explore dungeons from the story</color> once more. The higher the dungeon difficulty and the higher your rank, the better the rewards.
 
Criterion Dungeons can be accessed from Solo Content.

Criterion Dungeons allow you to revisit dungeons from the story for further exploration or to take on battles.
 
*Completing missions yield additional rewards.
Touching a symbol will trigger a boss battle. Not only will HP not be restored after each battle, but damage taken will also lower your max HP.
Dungeon-specific items can only be used within the respective dungeons. They can be accessed from the bag icon in the upper right.

<color=#95C7FF>Enhancement quests</color> have been unlocked. These quests yield lots of EXP and the materials necessary to <color=#95C7FF>enhance characters and equipment</color>. 
 
Enhancement quests can be accessed from Solo Content.

<color=#95C7FF>EXP, enhance materials, and synthesis materials</color> can be obtained from each quest.
 
<color=#9DB2CC>*<sprite="tmp_icon" index=782>(Stamina) is required to attempt these quests.</color>

The <color=#95C7FF>chocobo farm</color> has been unlocked. Here, you can <color=#95C7FF>purchase chocobos</color> or go on <color=#95C7FF>expeditions</color>.
 
The chocobo farm can be accessed from Chocobos.

Through <color=#661A00>chocobo expeditions</color>, you will <color=#661A00>discover items after a set amount of time</color>. The time and items vary with each chocobo's abilities. Characters sent on an expedition will <color=#661A00>earn EXP</color>.

There are <color=#661A00>different types</color> of expedition areas, and <color=#661A00>only chocobos that can traverse the respective areas</color> can be dispatched. Tap and hold on a chocobo to view their details.

Completed battles can be reattempted with <sprite="tmp_icon" index=781>(<color=#95C7FF>Stamina Boost</color>), which yields <color=#95C7FF>proportional EXP and rewards</color> for <sprite="tmp_icon" index=782>(stamina) consumed in a single attempt.
 
<color=#9DB2CC>*Stamina Boost cannot be used for all battles.</color>

You can check the items in your inventory from <color=#95C7FF>Items</color>.
  
You can also <color=#95C7FF>jump to the locations where items can be obtained</color> from "Acquired via."

The <color=#95C7FF>battle tower</color> has been unlocked. Progressing through this feature yields various rewards.
 
The tower can be accessed from Solo Content.

<color=#95C7FF>Crisis Dungeons</color> have been unlocked. These dungeons have a higher difficulty than criterion dungeons.
 
Crisis Dungeons can be accessed from Solo Content.
The objective is to explore the dungeon and aim for a high score. The harder the difficulty and higher your rank, the better the rewards.
Rewards include <color=#95C7FF>recipes for materia synthesis and <sprite="tmp_icon" index=772>(crisis medals)</color>. Create new materia to strengthen your party and achieve even higher scores.

<sprite="tmp_icon" index=775><color=#95C7FF>(Dungeon keys)</color> are required to attempt Crisis Dungeons. One is replenished <color=#95C7FF>daily</color>, but they can also be obtained with <color=#95C7FF>crystals</color>.

After defeating a Symbol enemy, you will be awarded a Trance Ability.
*You can choose 1 Trance Ability upon defeating a Symbol enemy.

Completing <color=#95C7FF>summon quests</color> unlocks <color=#95C7FF>Pact Missions</color> in summon streams. They also yield <color=#95C7FF>quest-exclusive weapons</color> and <color=#95C7FF>memories</color> used to unlock summon stream nodes.

<color=#95C7FF>Summon quests</color> allow you to battle summons and obtain <color=#95C7FF>summon weapons and summon enhance materials</color>. Completing summon battles unlocks the <color=#95C7FF>respective summon streams</color>.

<color=#95C7FF>Daily quests</color> have been unlocked. The quests are comprised of <color=#95C7FF>requests</color> that are updated <color=#95C7FF>every day</color>.
 
Daily quests can be accessed from Solo Content.

<color=#95C7FF>Daily quests</color> are comprised of <color=#95C7FF>different types of requests</color>, and each type has different rewards. Some requests allow you to <color=#95C7FF>select the reward of your choice.</color>

Story quests have been unlocked. They can be accessed from Solo Content.
 
These stories allow you to learn the original stories of each character.
Original stories and titles can be obtained from character story quests.

Getting hit with abilities fills an enemy's counter gauge, and when the gauge is full, they can unleash a counterattack. Depending on the enemy, the counter gauge fills with either physical or magic attacks. Check the icons displayed for this information.

This ability imprisons and incapacitates a character, preventing them from using abilities or filling their ATB gauge. The incapacitated character cannot be freed by abilities and must wait until the stream phrase is over.

The <color=#89D9FF>Hellfire gauge</color> fills over time, and when the gauge is filled, the enemy can unleash a powerful ability.
 
The <color=#89D9FF>number of sigils remaining</color> when the gauge is filled will determine the ability's power. The <color=#89D9FF>fewer</color> sigils remaining, the <color=#89D9FF>weaker</color> the ability.

The enemy's force gauge fills <color=#89D9FF>as they use their abilities</color>. The more the gauge is filled, the stronger their <color=#89D9FF>fire-based power</color>.
 
Dealing damage with <color=#89D9FF>ice-element abilities</color> will deplete the gauge.

The enemy's force gauge fills <color=#89D9FF>as they use their abilities</color>. The more the gauge is filled, the stronger their <color=#89D9FF>fire-resistance</color>.
 
Dealing damage with <color=#89D9FF>fire-element abilities</color> will deplete the gauge. When the gauge is fully depleted, <color=#89D9FF>the enemy will become incapacitated</color> for a set amount of time.
